Title: Financial Systems Analyst - FP&A
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA+1 location
Description:
Creates reports and analyzes data to identify solutions that meet business goals.
The Systems Analyst must have a broad base of technical knowledge and be…
Descriptions:
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Systems Analyst - FP&A will be responsible for serving the system needs of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) department. This role will be responsible for the day-to-day operation, maintenance, and enhancement of all ERP/EPM (Oracle Cloud EPM/PCM/EDM, Hyperion) applications and other FP&A tools and systems. In addition to the ERP/EPM support responsibilities, the Systems Analyst will be assigned additional projects in support of the Financial Planning & Analysis processes used by Delta Dental. The Systems Analyst must have a broad base of technical knowledge and be comfortable working in technical environments as well as with financial analysts, accountants, data and IT partners, and vendors.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Deploys, maintains, and troubleshoots core business applications, including application servers, associated hardware, endpoints, and databases
Meets and coordinates with internal and external stakeholders to establish project scope, system goals, and requirements
Develops, analyzes, prioritizes, and organizes requirement specifications, data mapping, diagrams, and flowcharts for developers and testers to follow
Translates highly technical specifications into clear non-technical requirements and the reverse
Manages the set-up and configuration of systems
Defines and coordinates the execution of testing procedures, and develop test cases to serve the overall quality assurance process
Provides documentation of all processes and training as needed
Develops and implements maintenance procedures, monitor systems health, gather system statistics, and troubleshoot reported errors and alarms
Performs design, implementation, and upgrades of information systems to meet the business and user needs
Implements best practices for scalability, supportability, ease of maintenance, and system performance
Creates reports and analyzes data to identify solutions that meet business goals
Analyzes current processes and identifies existing or potential problems in order to discover new process improvement opportunities
Collaborate with Technology team in managing Oracle EPM Cloud/Hyperion and other FP&A applications on an on-going basis to maintain and enhance the operation and security of those systems
Responsible for preparing Oracle EPM Cloud/Hyperion and other FP&A applications for planning, modeling, reporting, and budget and forecast cycles.
Oversee and maintain the integrity of data and logic within Oracle EPM Cloud/Hyperion and other FP&A applications from input to extraction to meet business needs
Assists users with problem solving related to Oracle EPM Cloud/Hyperion and other FP&A applications.
Contribute to other Oracle EPM Cloud/Hyperion and FP&A initiatives as assigned
This list is not all-inclusive and this position is expected to perform other duties as requested or assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
2+ w/Bachelor's degree
Experience in advance SQL scripting or other scripting languages and MS Office Suite, MS Teams, and SharePoint
Proven ability to assess business needs and translate them into relevant solutions
Solid multi-tasking abilities with project management skills
Strong critical thinking and abstract reasoning
Strong data interpretation skills to form actionable suggestions to support business requirements
Perform evaluation of historical trends to provide predictive insights
Ability to clearly present written information and findings
Excellent communication, presentation, team and interpersonal skills
Strong computer, hardware, software, and analytical skills
Strong research skills
Ability to get an overview and dive into details independently with little to no direction

Base Pay Information

The national base pay range at the end is a good-faith estimate of what Delta Dental may pay for new hires. Actual pay may vary based on Delta Dental's assessment of the candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities (KSAs), related experience, education, certifications and ability to meet required minimum job qualifications. Other factors impacting pay include prevailing wages in the work location and internal equity. $55,000 - $116,900

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Title: IT Systems Analyst
Description:
Analyze data and provide data sets to users for analysis.
The incumbent works closely with the other Software developers, Business analysts, QA and the…
Descriptions:
Stanford’s University Information Technology (UIT) organization services diverse clientele from various university business units and schools. We are a hub of business analysts, developers, testers and architects who design and build applications to support core functions of the University.

We are looking for a passionate IT Systems Analyst to join our Middleware and Integration Services (MaIS) group in Enterprise Technology (ET) within University IT. MaIS is responsible for services and technologies that are used by the campus community and by University business systems to manage enterprise data about people, organizations, courses, workgroups, and authority. The group manages a set of central Registries and additionally supports a suite of Java developed applications and background processes which facilitate enterprise integration.

This position is for a team focused on development and maintenance of these systems. The incumbent works closely with the other Software developers, Business analysts, QA and the deployment and operations teams. A successful candidate will have demonstrated a track record of specifying requirements and/or design solutions for business information systems and incorporate new technical systems to improve work-flow, production, efficiency and effectiveness. May serve as project lead.

Core Duties:
Translate business processes into system requirements and/or development of systems solutions.
Analyze new business requirements, assist with feasibility of enhancement requests, system functionality, current system use and user needs.
Specify functional analysis and design and work with developers and analysts to recommend solutions and resolve system issues.
Review, research and evaluate software to determine its usefulness and appropriateness as related to existing or proposed business systems; assist or develop preliminary and detailed system design documentation.
Perform testing of new systems, upgrades and patching of existing systems; plan, conduct and document results of testing.
Develop instructional materials, training and job aids.
Advise users requiring assistance in solving complex problems or issues regarding management and business systems.
Analyze data and provide data sets to users for analysis. May include development of operational and analytical reports for end users.
Liaise with external vendors or partners in support of business systems, which may include system development, implementation and/or operations.
Coordinate the implementation of new or modified business systems.

Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering, and five years relevant experience or a combination of education and relevant experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes, and workflow.
Experience with enterprise applications and understanding of database driven applications.
Passion for working with end users to understand their needs and improve their end-user experience
Strong understanding of the software development life cycle.
Oracle PL/SQL development and SQL programming experience preferred
Experience working with Oracle Application Express (APEX) desired
Knowledge of principles and techniques used in conducting management studies and in systems analysis.
Current knowledge of rapidly changing computer technology.
Skill in conducting interviews and facilitating group meetings.
Skill in developing and conducting training programs.
Strong User Interface design skills and experience crafting effective system solutions
Ability to design and document complex business systems.
Able to work on multiple initiatives at a time with an ability to manage and prioritize work
A solid grasp of technical problems, capabilities, and solutions especially around database applications
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to bridge functional and technical resources by communicating effectively with individuals of varying systems expertise and business needs.
Strong listening, negotiation and conflict resolution skills.
Proven problem solving and analytical thinking and ability to approach problems logically and systematically.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
Constantly perform desk-based computer tasks.
Frequently sit, grasp lightly/fine manipulation.
Occasionally stand/walk, use a telephone.
Rarely writing by hand, lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.

The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.

Stanford is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
May work extended hours, evening and weekends.

WORK STANDARDS:
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University’s Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.

Relocation or sponsorship will not be provided for this position.

Descriptions:
Senior IT Business Analyst

OAKLAND-HYBRID, CA


Job Title : Senior IT Business Analyst

Work Type: Hybrid

Job Location: Oakland

Position Summary

We are looking for a Senior Level IT Business Analyst in Measure and Field Services team who can be a quick learner, thorough, organized, flexible to adapt in fast paced and dynamic environments. The analyst is mainly responsible for analyzing business requirements and developing function requirement and functional design documents. In addition, the analyst is responsible for analyzing O&M and project defects to determine business/technical impact and providing recommendation on fixing the defects. This position also partners with the various lines of business to perform feasibility studies and produce associated concept estimates.

Client is providing the salary range that the company in good faith believes it might pay for this position at the time of the job posting. This compensation range is specific to the locality of the job. The actual salary paid to an individual will be based on multiple factors, including, but not limited to, specific skills, education, licenses or certifications, experience, market value, geographic location, and internal equity. We would not anticipate that the individual hired into this role would land at or near the top half of the range described below, but the decision will be dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case.

ACTUAL BAY AREA SALARY RANGE: $102,000.00 TO $132,000.00

ACTUAL CALIFORNIA SALARY RANGE: $97,000.00 TO $125,000.00

This position is hybrid, working from your remote office and your assigned location based on business need.


Responsibilities

Ideation:
Work with business organizations to provide input regarding enhancement feasibility
Using business process knowledge, proactively look for opportunities for system enhancements
Evaluate and provide input to “business concept requirements”
Prepare preliminary design for concept estimation purposes
Project:
Analyze/assemble requirements
Provide technical expertise and assistance in designing, testing and developing applications
Perform feasibility analysis, design and provide recommendations on the alternative solutions, project strategy and deliverable prioritization, as well as system alternatives or enhancements to current systems
Prepare final functional requirement and functional design documentation
Conduct walkthrough of deliverables with business and obtain approval/signoff
Provide SME support to developers and testers
Work with business to document and analyze project change controls
Support stabilization of deployed code
O&M:
Troubleshoot potential MTC system issues to determine if there is a defect
Analyze production defects, identify business and system impacts and quantify problems
Contribute to defect troubleshooting and solution design
Assist business and technical teams with adhoc requests
Provide functional expertise to clients for resolving business issues
Qualifications

Minimum:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/ Information Systems, Business, Engineering, etc. or equivalent work experience
4 years of job-related experience in Information Technology. 3 years of experience in business analysis. Can have less experience in case of an advanced degree
Minimum 3 years of experience with Oracle CC&B application, MDM, and data modeling
Participation in projects of medium to high complexity
Familiarity with the corresponding Line of Business-related functions
Continuous education in IT and business specific areas
Desired:
Minimum 5 years of experience in analyzing, designing and developing functional requirements and application functional designs
Experience in Meter Data Management, Meter Configurations and Field Services
Working knowledge of relational databases, including data querying is a plus
Be able to design as an individual but within the framework of the team and product
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Collaborate with cross functional teams to maintain efficiency, consistency and achieve successful implementation of system enhancement
Working knowledge of MS Office suite of applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

Title: Project Analyst - 1344165
Description:
Manage data from multiple sources, analyze the data, manipulate the data, and package the data in specified formats.
SQL and Microsoft SQL Server.
Descriptions:
ENTRUST Solutions Group is an ENR Top 100 company. We are a community of people, 3,000+ strong, who are committed to our clients and each other. We are diverse, talented, dedicated, and wholly focused on not only meeting the needs of our clients but exceeding their expectations.

We provide comprehensive and dependable engineering, consulting, and automation services to gas and electric utilities, telecommunication service providers, pipeline operators, and industrial companies. With first-hand experience operating and maintaining energy infrastructure, our engineering professionals provide expertise in Renewables, Power Services, GIS and Data Solutions, Automation Integration, Pipeline Engineering, Integrity Services, Industrial Solutions, Telecommunications, and Process Safety Management.

At ENTRUST, we work together as a team to accomplish more than we would individually, delivering innovative engineering solutions to meet our clients’ needs, while consistently maintaining the highest level of ethics and integrity.

We are passionate about what we do, how we do it, and who we do it for. We work with a smile, connect easily with others, and believe that work-life balance and a flexible work environment benefits everyone.

In return for top talent, ENTRUST Solutions Group offers competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and a positive work environment designed around the philosophy of mutual respect and the challenge of contributing to the continued success of our organization.

We’re actively seeking a Data Analyst to provide data validation, analysis, and quality assurance on data gathered on fallen trees in Northern California
Manage data from multiple sources, analyze the data, manipulate the data, and package the data in specified formats.
Ability to dive deep into the data pool and resurface with the appropriate analysis.
Use statistical methods to analyze data, create, build, and manage useful tailored analytics reports and dashboards for multiple audiences.
Ensure data integrity by performing quality checks.

QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, Mathematics, Engineering, Environmental Science, Geographic Information Systems, Information Systems, Business, or relatable degree is required.
1-7 years of proven reporting and analytics experience within business, project management, and/or consulting environments.
Ability to manage and pull data from multiple data sources, import the data into various forms and sculpt the data for presentation to various audiences.
Extensive experience creating tailored reports…dashboarding a plus!
Ability to create, modify, automate, and run SQL queries needed to mine and analyze data.
SQL and Microsoft SQL Server.
Strong data analysis, data modeling, database management, and data manipulation.
Extensive MS Excel knowledge, preferably the Power Suite (Power Query, Power Pivot).
MS Access
Familiar with data-structures.
Proven experience meeting concurrent deliverables on time and within specified requirements.
Proven ability to understand both business processes as well as the underlying data.

All offers are contingent upon receipt of satisfactory results of a pre-employment drug test and criminal background screening.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

Compensation and Benefits:
This position pays between $60,000 and $83,000 annually and is an exempt position.
Benefits offered include company sponsored medical, dental, vision, and 401(k) plan with company match. Also offered are tuition reimbursement, voluntary life, disability, critical illness, accident and hospitalization plans. HSA or FSA medical accounts and FSA dependent care and transportation/parking accounts are also available. These benefits are subject to employee contribution amounts generally set annually.
Full time employees are eligible to earn PTO hours.
May be eligible for discretionary bonus as determined by the company.

Title: Compensation & Benefits Analyst
Location: Hybrid remote in San Carlos, CA
Description: Gather data from the platform and use spreadsheet and data analysis techniques to assess results and market trends.
Descriptions:
The Company

Noah Medical is building the future of medical robotics. Our next generation robotic platform targets early diagnosis and treatment of patients across multiple disease states. Based in Silicon Valley and backed by well-known institutional investors, our incredibly talented team of 150+ engineers, innovators and industry leaders brings years of experience from the top healthcare companies in the world, including: Intuitive, Auris, Stryker, Johnson & Johnson, Boston Scientific, Verb Surgical, Mako, Think Surgical, Medrobotics & Hansen.

The Compensation & Benefits Analyst is responsible for managing Noah’s employee compensation and benefits programs and ensuring these programs align with the company's goals and competitive practices. This position is also responsible for ensuring that company compensation and benefits programs are consistently administered in compliance with internal policies and government regulations.

This position will be hybrid but will be required to be in person a minimum of 3 days in our San Carlos office. Occasional travel to our East Bay office will also be required.

Below is some additional detail on key responsibilities of this role.
Compensation (55%):
Serve as the Compensation expert within the company to analyze data on wages and implement Noah’s total rewards program. Analyze trends in compensation and provide insight into how these compare to what Noah offers. Research and propose competitive base and incentive pay programs to ensure the organization attracts and retains top talent.
Determine job requirements and evaluate job positions to ensure the company is competitive in the areas of salaries and total compensation. Prepare and maintain job descriptions for each position in the organization, ensure descriptions and job classifications accurately reflect the work being performed by incumbents. Benchmark jobs against survey data and other market intelligence to determine competitive compensation ranges for each position.
Serve as Noah’s liaison to the salary & equity benchmarking platform (Radford). Submit required data reports on both an annual and ad hoc basis. Gather data from the platform and use spreadsheet and data analysis techniques to assess results and market trends. Make recommendations to managers during salary and equity reviews.
Support the Recruiting Lead and HR Lead with any related recruitment and talent management activities.
Benefits (40%):
Serve as the Benefits Admin for all full-time employees. Manage and maintain benefit plans to ensure the best possible offerings to employees. Maintain a strong understanding and appreciation of the benefits Noah offers and act as a resource to employees when they have questions.
Administer all health, welfare and retirement plans, including enrollments, changes and terminations, processing required documentation to ensure accurate record-keeping.
Facilitate accurate and timely delivery of employer contributions and employee payroll deductions to carriers, plan administrators, or other appropriate service providers in partnership with Noah’s Payroll Administrator.
Research employee benefits in similar industries, work with insurance brokers and investment planners to recommend changes or updates to the company’s existing benefits or policies to create competitive, cost-effective benefits packages for the organization.
Conduct focus groups to collect employee feedback on specific issues or topics related to benefits and compensation.
Ensure the organization’s and plans’ compliance with the applicable provisions of COBRA, HIPAA, and other relevant requirements. Manage, coordinate, and advise all staff on the processes pertaining to FMLA, PFL, or any other personal leaves of absence.
Monitor administrators’ and insurance carriers’ reports to ensure the organization’s compliance with plan requirements. Complete records, reporting, and other documentation required by federal, state, and provider rules, regulations, and policies.
HRIS/Other (5%):
Review and update HR systems to support future growth and drive automation that will allow the HR team to stay effective, reduce manual routine work, and support the necessary level of reporting for compliance.
Oversee and monitor employee data for accuracy across all HRIS systems including employee status and benefits changes, supervision/title/program changes, etc.
Provide timely and accurate employee metrics to management
Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices. Review policies and practices to maintain compliance.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in business, human resources or related fields is required and 5-8 years of employee compensation and benefits administration.
Experience managing benefits and compensation in coordination with a Human Resource Information System (HRIS) and Benefits Administrative platform, experience with Maxwell and BambooHR is a plus.
Extensive knowledge of human resource laws, federal, state and local regulations and best practices. Thorough knowledge of COBRA, HIPAA, and FMLA requirements.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret and communicate data. Extensive knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Drive or similar software.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Strong interpersonal skills in dealing with senior management.
Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Noah Medical reserves the right to modify this range as needed. Please note that the aforementioned range is only one component of the position's total compensation package. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonuses, stock and employee benefits including but not limited to PTO, paid holidays, health insurance, dental & vision insurance, life & disability insurance and a 401k plan. Additional details on the compensation package and employee benefits offerings will be provided to candidates during the interview process.

Noah Medical is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to ensuring an inclusive environment for our employees. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, physical or mental disability, marital or protected military or veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws.

Noah Medical is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and we will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Noah Medical.

Title: Senior Systems Analyst
Description: Inventories and documents data stored throughout the City; identifies duplication and ambiguities in City data; proposes and designs solutions for harmonizing…
Descriptions:
The Position


The City of Berkeley is currently accepting applications for Senior Systems Analyst in the Information Technology Department.

Under general direction, the Senior Systems Analyst performs systems analysis and design for large complex systems; prepares or directs the preparation of complex programs and systems; analyzes and coordinates databases on a city-wide basis; may direct and review the work of employees assigned to assist on major projects; performs related work as assigned.

We are seeking to fill two positions in this classification:

Infrastructure Lead:
Leading an infrastructure team, this individual will coordinate, maintain, upgrade and provide overall support for computer systems, telephony (VoIP) and networks to ensure proper security and operation, plan, coordinate and implement system software changes for enterprise servers, resolve technology problems and provide for system enhancements including end-user computing devices, mobile devices, virtual desktops and servers, storage and networking devices, local and wide area networks (LANs/WANs), telephony (currently Avaya VoIP) and cloud based information systems (SaaS, PaaS, etc).

IT Portfolio Manager:
This position will be responsible for facilitating the management and process for analyzing value, evaluating risk, prioritizing and onboarding new technology project requests to ensure alignment with organizational strategy. The position oversees the coordination of projects in execution as well as planning those in the pipeline. The ideal candidate for this role is a polymath in IT systems, infrastructure and planning & analysis.

In both of these roles, the individual is capable of, and willing to roll-up his/her sleeves to get things done. These positions collaborate with all IT and various City departments.

CLASS CHARACTERISTICS
Incumbents of this class are highly skilled in systems analysis and serve in senior capacity or as project leaders on major system design, data analysis, and implementation projects. This class prepares the more difficult systems design, programs and procedures and handles the more complex systems analysis assignments, and performs data analysis, database design and design of other systems such as Web sites and Geographical Information Systems (GIS). Work assignments are received in general terms where there is considerable latitude for independent judgment and initiative as to the method of approach and solution to the problem. A Senior Systems Analyst may assist in the training of less experienced staff members and provide supervision and guidance. System analysis, design activities, high-level programming skills, and data administration are emphasized in this classification. This class is distinguished from the Supervising Systems Analyst, which is responsible for planning, scheduling, assigning and reviewing the work of the systems and programming staff, in addition to performing complex analyses and systems design as required.

Examples of duties may include but are not limited to:
1. Surveys and analyzes major existing or proposed systems in complex application areas; confers with departments to determine system functions, procedures, desired results and problem definition;
2. Conducts feasibility studies and prepares reports of time estimates, personnel requirements, and progress reports on assigned projects; reduces design projects into component analysis tasks and prepares final systems design, specifications and documentation necessary for programming;
3. Prepares and/or modifies complex and extensive computer programs; directs and assists in the writing, testing, and debugging of programs and ensures that documentation is complete prior to releasing for operations; personally performs the more difficult aspects of the work;
4. Identifies program packages that may meet users' needs; develops evaluation criteria for packages; participates in purchasing process; works with vendor and users' designs and coordinates package implementation strategy; ensures packaged system is performing to specification; supplements vendor training; provides programming support for package as required;
5. Inventories and documents data stored throughout the City; identifies duplication and ambiguities in City data; proposes and designs solutions for harmonizing City data; identifies requirements for additional data; identifies sources of missing City data in other organizations and develops strategies for its integration;
6. May provide technical guidance; plan, direct and review the work of staff members of assigned projects; may review and evaluate programs, procedures, and input forms for uniformity and consistency of format;
7. Creates high-level Web site design and Web programming;
8. Analyzes data attributes, coordinate datasets, and create corresponding electronic mapping information.
9. Coordinates large-scale computer processes with users and Information Systems personnel regarding scheduling;
10. Monitors changes and developments in the programming, systems analysis, and data administration field by attending seminars, conferences and lectures, and by reviewing professional literature; evaluates their application to City activities and recommends implementation;
11. May coordinate project development and implementation activities with system consultants and contract programming personnel;
12. May assist in training subordinate staff members and user personnel; and
13. Performs related duties as assigned.
Required Qualifications


Minimum Qualifications
EDUCATION:
Completion of four (4) years of college resulting in graduation or its equivalent

AND

EXPERIENCE:
Three (3) years of experience in systems analysis and programming of business applications, including one (1) year in the analysis or design of large-scale computer systems and databases.
Knowledge and Abilities
Knowledge and Abilities

Note: The level and scope of the knowledge and skills listed below are related to job duties as defined under Class Characteristics.

Knowledge of:

1. Computer programming, systems analysis, principles and techniques for business applications;

2. The use, functions, capabilities and requirements of computer and communications hardware;

3. Applicable programming languages and operating systems;

4. Program specification, design, testing, prototyping, work-flow for business information systems;

5. Working knowledge of the accounting, statistical, and business administration systems and procedures; and

6. Data normalization, data flow analysis, structured systems analysis, file and database design.

Skill in:

1. Analyzing complex procedures and data, and drawing logical conclusions in developing new systems and procedures for business information;

2. Preparing complete and concise program specifications and documentation;

3. Investigating proposals for new systems or program modifications and preparing feasibility reports and time and labor estimates; coordinating and controlling the development and implementation of major system design or modification projects.

4. Preparing computer programs in extensive and complex application areas.

5. Creating file and database designs.

6. Thinking logically in symbolic terms and interpreting graphic representations of physical processes.

7. Preparing clear and concise reports.

8. Directing and reviewing the work of others when applicable.

9. Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with representatives of using departments, operations personnel and other members of the programming staff.

10. Training less experienced employees and user personnel when applicable; and

11. Explaining systems to non-technical users.
Application Process
To Applicants must submit the following:
1. City of Berkeley Employment Application
2. Responses to the Supplemental Questionnaire
3.Resume

All materials must be received no later than 5:00 PM (PST) on the filing date. Postmarks, faxes and incomplete applications will not be accepted. Resumes are not a substitute for a completed application.

The examination process can consist of:
Review of applications for minimum qualifications for the position and to ensure all materials have been submitted.
The examination process is subject to change. Applicants passing all examination phases will have their names placed on an employment eligible list that hiring department(s) will use to conduct final selection interviews. Hiring Department(s) will contact applicants directly if selected to participate in their hiring/selection process.

Candidates under final consideration for employment with the City should expect to undergo an employment background / reference check that may include, but is not limited to: employment history, confirmation of educational credentials and degrees, licenses including driver's license, registrations, certificates, and other credentials as part of the appointment process. Some positions, depending on the nature of the work, also require a credit check and a review of Summary Criminal History obtained from the State Department of Justice through Live Scan fingerprinting.

Title: Club Financial Analyst
Description:
Ability to prepare and analyze data, figures and transcriptions prepared on and generated by computer.
Maintains and evaluate geographic/demographic data…
Descriptions:
The Club Financial Analyst analyzes financial information to evaluate club strategies, develops presentations to the Board of Directors and department heads.
Salary Range:
$80,000-$130,000 based on experience
Essential Duties:
Prepares financial reports such as pro formas, reforecast and cash flow statements
Prepares presentations for GM, Board of Directors and other departments as requested.
Manages club statistics such as rounds played, revenues, payroll forecast, flash report, etc.
Updates clubs statistics for club, committees and Board of Directors.
Gathers needed information utilizing various forms of media such as phone surveys, the Internet, interdepartmental and inter-company sources, etc.
Prepares club financial analyses for evaluating company performance and strategy.
Create investment tools, which evaluate overall value and rate of return for specific projects and events.
Prepares and maintain customized financial statements and other financial models at the club level for General Manager, Troon Golf, banks and other users as needed.
Prepares financial reports.
Maintains and evaluate geographic/demographic data relating to the club, its competitors, and the overall market.
Performs periodic desktop or on-site due diligence assignments.
Maintains flexibility to take on new and different tasks as directed by the General Manager.
Regular and reliable attendance.
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university, Masters of Business Administration (MBA) preferred; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Physical Demands:
Typical office environment. Moderate travel required.
Environment/Noise:
The noise level is moderate.
Job Knowledge, Skill, and Ability Preferences:
Professionalism, organization, and ability to multi-task required.
Ability to read and speak English may be required in order to perform the duties of the job (e.g. the associates may be required to communicate with English speaking customers or co-workers, the manuals for the equipment the associates may use are in English).
Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications.
Possess basic computational ability.
Possess basic computer skills.
Exceptional organizational skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects daily.
Ability to prepare and analyze data, figures and transcriptions prepared on and generated by computer.
Possess a high level of accuracy and neatness.
This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of all job functions that an associate in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.

Title: Sr Info Mgmt Analyst
Company: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
Location: Hybrid remote in San Francisco, CA 94105
Description:
Excellent attention to detail and customer service skills.
Final salary and offer will be determined by the applicant’s background, experience, skills, internal…
Descriptions:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
While the SF Fed is a Reserve Bank, we’re not what you might expect. We’re unreserved here. That means we seek new and diverse perspectives. We spark conversations and encourage debate. We build opportunity. We pursue careers that are true to ourselves. We are looking for people who want to help our country reach its full economic potential. When you join the SF Fed, you join a team of people working together to promote an inclusive economy that works for everyone.

The Sr. Information Management Analyst executes the framework, strategy, priorities, policies, and guidelines for the 12th District’s Information Management Program (IMP) which includes records management, information management, and information governance. Provides expert advice and best practice solutions to help the Federal Reserve System (FRS) and 12th District (FRB) improve processes, realize efficiencies, and mitigate legal, operational, and reputational risk. Works with business lines to ensure compliance with the System Records Retention Manual (SRRM), Local Records Retention Schedule (LRRS), and Information Governance framework. Leads and/or provides in depth support to FRS and FRB IMP-related group initiatives; plus, may participate directly in these groups.
Responsibilities:
Executes the 12th District’s IMP framework, strategy, priorities, policies, and guidelines.
Maintains an in-depth knowledge of concepts, processes, technology tools and risk management as it relates to records management, information management and information governance.
Identifies and leads cross functional projects where project scope may be complex and sensitive in nature; manages scope, schedule, and resources including key stakeholders, applicable business areas and external consultants to meet project deliverables.
enhances and ensures maintenance of procedures, and quality assurance testing methodologies; plans and coordinates testing, analyzes results, recommends improvement opportunities and employs solutions.
Promotes strong risk management, project management, and process-improvement practices.
Works with business units to develop and review file plans to ensure compliance with the SRRM, LRRS and Information Governance framework.
Develops and delivers FRB training; provides input into FRS training; and provides technical assistance and training to FRB staff.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in library or information Science, or related field; master’s degree preferred.
Five to seven years of experience in records management, information management, and/or information governance.
Three plus years of experience with records management, information management, and/or information governance at a Public / Government Agency or the FRS.
Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive information with the highest degree of integrity.
Demonstrated ability to adapt and apply industry best practices to the IMP at both FRS and FRB levels.
Demonstrated ability to work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors and resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways in alignment with FRS and FRB policies.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously, understand associated technology, and analyze data and industry trends in order to recommend and make improvements to the IMP.
Strong independent thinking and decision-making ability; ability to exercise sound judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Expertise in current records management, information management, and information governance industry practices and landscape, particularly as it pertains to the FRS and FRB
Demonstrated ability to work professionally and collaboratively with personnel at all levels of the FRS and FRB.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and manage verbally, in writing, and via presentation complex and technical topics relating to records management, information management, and information governance.
Excellent attention to detail and customer service skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite applications.
Demonstrated knowledge of metadata and its application.
Strong understanding of FRS and FRB’s mandate, mission, and associated business functions, activities and business processes.
Robust knowledge of FRS and FRB information security classification methodologies and tools.
In depth knowledge of concepts, processes, technology tools and risk management as it relates to records management, information management and information governance.
In depth knowledge of managing information and records from the point of creation through to disposition, including management of records transferred to archives.
In depth knowledge of the following International Standards Organization’s:
ISO 16175 Principles and Functional Requirements for Records in Electronic Office Environments
ISO 15489 Information and documentation – Records Management
ISO 23081 Information and documentation – Records Management Processes – Metadata for records
ISO 14641 Electronic Archiving
ISO 19005 Document Management – Electronic Document File Format for Long Term Preservation
ISO 14721 Space Data and Information Transfer Systems – Open Archival Information Systems (OAIS) Reference Model
ISO 30300 Information and Documentation – Management Systems for Records – Fundamentals and Vocabulary
ISO 30301 Information and Documentation – Management Systems for Records - Requirements
MoReq 2010 Model Requirements for the Management of Electronic Records
ISO 8000 Data Quality
ISO 27001 Information Security Management
Base Salary Range: Min: $84,600, Mid: $109,800, Max: 135,100 (Location: San Francisco )

Final salary and offer will be determined by the applicant’s background, experience, skills, internal equity, and alignment with geographic and other market data.
At the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, we offer a wonderful benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Pretax Flexible Spending Account, Paid Family Leave Care, Backup Child Care Program, Pretax Day Care Flexible Spending Account, Vacation Days, Sick Days, Paid Holidays, Pet Insurance, Matching 401(k), and an unheard-of Retirement / Pension.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
At the SF Fed, we believe in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve. The SF Fed is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
#LI-Hybrid

Full time

Regular

Yes

Operations

The Federal Reserve Banks are committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.
